metadata.name: [WAITING TO BE SIGNED]
metadata.description: This Gentk is waiting to be signed by the fxhash signer module

metadata.name: Quantum Folly #244
metadata.description:
This piece explores humanity's vanity and obsession with controlling natural forces. In the end we are beholden to the whims of the universe and its rules. What we think is artificial is but nature's inclination.

As an atom gazes at the world it can see the arrogant hand of mankind imposing its will. We are nature's inane creation built from imperceptible, discrete particles.

Enjoy watching the structures form. Due to the nature of the system it may take some time to complete. Once it's fully rendered you can download a full resolution image of 3508 x 4961 px by ***double clicking/tapping***. At this size the piece is printable at A3 size at 300 dpi. If you're interested in acquiring a signed print please contact @KRANKARTA.

Features include: palette, orientation, architecture, particle rules, boundary seepage and colour displacement.

Created on Chrome desktop 103.0 on 2022-07-21 in javascript and GLSL. Results on other browsers/devices may vary.

metadata.name: Floatrest #184
metadata.description:
Floating forests over the endless sky, where birds, trees, plants, roots, rocks and waterfalls share an ecosystem full of life and emotion.

You can see some rain clouds in the sky and the sun shining under the raindrops.

The earth is moving, the blocks are falling, but the trees are strong in their roots.

Welcome to 'Floatrest'.

----

# Features

- 7 tree palettes
- 17 different background colors
- 10 different terrain colors
- clouds
- vines
- roots
- plants
- waterfall
- birds
- sun / moon
- night
- dark mode
- monochromatic
- 2 different aspect ratios (square & portrait)
- Press "p" on live mode to save in PNG

This artwork requires processing power and is intended for laptops and desktops primarily. It may take some time to render.

----

July 2022, gpitombo

metadata.name: Momentary #107
metadata.description:
Sometimes, life's troubles seem to be immense and endless. They make us run around in despair, helplessly looking in every direction in search of an answer.

It's tough to be in control of those situations until we understand that everything in our life is momentary, the good times are momentary and of course the bad ones.

We tend to forget that life finds its way and that we just need to hold enough to start to see a clear path to follow.

Life is momentary, the good times are momentary and of course the bad ones.

Hold enough.

There is a path to follow.

-------
WARNING
Please, have into consideration that this work requires some CPU power due to the number of points that needs to be drawn on the canvas. Depending on the hardware and work features, the drawing could take some seconds to some minutes to be finished. 
-------

/- Features

/- Color Scheme
-. Vintage graphite
-. Ashes
-. Serenity
-. Blossom
-. Dark chocolate
-. Blue pen

/- Sky Texture
-. Pencil strokes left
-. Pencil strokes right
-. Pointed lines diagonal
-. Pointed lines vertical
-. Crosshatch
-. Clean

/- Celestial Object
-. Fire burst type A
-. Fire burst type B
-. Eclipse
-. Flare
-. Void

/- Terrain QTY.
-. 1 to 5

/- Terrain Type
-. Blasted sand
-. Peaceful sand
-. Rocky ridges

/- Terrain accent
-. True
-. False

/- Dripping ridges
-. True
-. False

/- Frame
-. True
-. False

-------

/- Controls

[p] Save image @ 2000x2300 px.
[Backspace] Pause the animation.
[Enter] Play the animation. 

-------

metadata.name: Vers #223
metadata.description:
Vers

A flexibility in regards to position.

V : Switch the top to the bottom or vice versa
A : Toggle reveal animation/title card
S : Save current resolution
1 -> 5 : Save low -> high resolution

metadata.name: Polar Grid #420
metadata.description:
Polar Grid is part of the fxhash live minting experience at Proof of People, London 2022.

This is a study of color, motion, and composition, and an homage to cinema as an artform. Colorful shapes overlap and pulse in a ever repeating dance. An abstracted movie experience. Each color palette in the series (except one) is inspired by a different film director (if you want a real challenge, see how many you can guess without looking at the feature names).

The palettes were extracted from movie stills or movie posters and fine tuned by hand. As often, I have to thank independent tool makers for their indirect help. My gratitude goes to David Aerne for FarbVélo and Fabrizio Bianchi for Coolors.

The code for Polar Grid is based on early iterations of what ultimately became my carat series. Both projects come from the same fascination for color as a system, even though I used a different approach here. You could call this a carat prequel.

The animation is done using a technique called polar noise. This makes it so the motion of all elements ends up repeating in the same amount of time. This is useful for generating motion that loops perfectly while still appearing organic. In this particular case, the animation repeats every π × 100 seconds.

A challenge in building any generative system is to find the right balance between coherence and variety. I designed the system with the large edition size in mind. During development I generated hundreds of iterations and tweaked my code to make sure that every iteration is truly unique and fits the overall aesthetic of the collection.

I truly hope you will enjoy your own little abstract movie.

— Raphaël de Courville


Released: July 6th 2022

Medium: p5.js, html canvas, css

Reference: sk220621


**About the artist**

Raphaël de Courville is a generative artist, streamer, and educator. His artistic work is an exploration of generative systems, patterns, interactivity, and time. Born in Paris, he lives and works in Berlin.


**Instructions**

- Click/Tap or press SPACEBAR to play and pause the animation

In Fullscreen mode (desktop only):
- Press UP or DOWN arrows to adjust image quality (Note: this can affect performance)
- Press F to hide/show the browser UI
